column5: I let the pooch out at 3:15 and it almost felt like a summertime breeze with a temperature of + 4  First time it's been above freezing for quite awhile, but I'll take it
A welcome break. We are fortunate to be able to have warm climes compared to some of our US neighbours.
42 f here with the morning news, LOL melt down!
Lew I was about to go back in the house this morning and put shorts and a T on. Man what a rise in temps.Ah this is nice.
I also was surprised when I let the dogs out a little while ago.  Nice warm-up over night.  Maybe some of the hard-packed snow and ice will melt off our streets.
You have snow down there in the south.LOL
Plus one up here even, and no rain or nothing....is spring coming or something??? I guess my mom's coming for a visit  Maureen

Woke up at around 5:30 this morning and could here drip..drip..drip..drip. The leaky trough(gutter) dripping on the aluminum awning over the bedroom window.  So I got up, turned on the tube and flicked through the channels. Found the weather on a Buffalo channel, it was 38 degrees there and 39 in Hamilton. Spring is here?
Bring on the softwater!
Now, now.. don't let this fool you. Every year it is the same thing. There is still some cold yet to come. Hate to put a damper on the warm spell, but that's life.
Winter is definately not over....but a couple days like this...I'll take it...wow it just feels SOOOO nice...  Jason

I think were ALL aware that there will probably be more cold weather to come, but the warm temperatures forecast for the next few days are just a nice break from the cold weather we've all endured for the last month.
YEH!!  Woke up, went to the car....breathed in that nice mild air....ahhh....it's nice not to have my facial hair freeze when I breathe....LOL.
Hey Lew, you slept in today (3:15)! I had to strategically walk my dog today in order to minimize mud coverage on her undercarriage!
Morning Lew, the walk with Marv today will be a little warmer for sure.
Nope, I was up and at it by 2:30, it was Marvin who slept in till 3:15  Boy, that mutt sure is gettin lazy in his old age  And your right Jim, he never even wore his coat this morning.
Morning all....  First above freezing day we have had in more than a month. Certainly is welcome.
To quick a spring thaw hurts the walleye spawn here, muddies up the spawning grounds and the silt can hurt the eggs( Bury them)
it's giving me the itch for some spring fishing already......
3 weeks of winter, I'll take that!
3 weeks of winter, I'll take that!
I walked home from school today in the best mood I have been in for months.  Cant wait for that first day that you dont have to wear a jacket outside in the afternoon!

on the brighter side,they say that on average the first sightings of robins around the GTA,is macrch 10th and thats only 2 weeks away,and so is march break....YE-HAAAAAAAA     GOD PLEASE HURRY AND BRING ON THE OPEN WATER...sorry to all the ice - fishing guys...lol..lol
